page.title: 02ALNWICK FAIR.
page.content:
leads the traditional and colourful procession through the town and a Herald proclaims the commencement of the Fair.The week ahead is very interestingand amusing.There is a dailly open air market which includes many dispays and demonstrations of local crafts, music,food,dancing,etc.
The modern Alnwick fair began in 1969. Every year it begins on the last Sunday in June and lasts a week. It is a reminder of the old traditional fairs and everyone dresses in costumes, dating from 1750 _ 1850. In those days boys and men used to go to the Fairs and shout, "I'm for hire," and hope someone would give them work.
There are lots of stalls set up in the Market Place selling roast ox sandwiches, home_made sweets, pottery
